fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Audio bitstream produced by the Windows Media 9 lossless audio codec.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Audio bitstream produced by the Windows Media 9 lossless audio codec.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Used for middle-state purposes, e.g., archiving of high-quality files.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: Windows Media Audio file with WMA9_LL codec

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Extent of adoption is not known; the WMA file format is widely adopted. The lossless codec is specialized and may not see wide adoption.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:licensingAndPatents: See ASF for link to pages covering licensing of Windows Media and the Advanced Systems Format.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:transparency: Depends upon algorithms and tools to read; will require sophistication to build tools.

fdd:soundQF.fdd:fidelity: From the codecs page at the Microsoft Windows Media web site (consulted September 7, 2010): "This codec is a great codec to use for archiving CD collections. Although the compression ratio achieved with this codec is lower than the ratio achieved with other Windows Media Audio 9 codecs, it is still more efficient than direct copying of the digital media content. Using this codec, content will be compressed at a 2:1 or 3:1 ratio depending on the complexity of the original. The audio quality of content compressed using this codec is the best of all Windows Media codecs."

fdd:urlReference.tag: Encoding Audio and Video with Windows Media Codecs.
